liveDemo.title: See Real-time Optimization in Action
liveDemo.subtitle: 24-hour building simulation using Hungarian grid carbon intensity patterns based on MAVIR data
liveDemo.step2Detail: Building retains heat during peak hours
liveDemo.implementationDetail: This simulation uses Hungarian grid carbon intensity patterns modeled after MAVIR grid characteristics. Our GradientBoosting model predicts heating demand with 35% better accuracy than baseline systems. The algorithm uses physics-based thermal modeling and carbon-aware scheduling to optimize energy usage while maintaining comfort within building thermal mass constraints.

calculator.title: Your Potential Savings
calculator.disclaimer: Based on validated model trained on 11,310+ real Hungarian data points. Actual savings may vary based on your specific building and usage patterns.

modelPerformance.title: Proven Technical Results
modelPerformance.subtitle: Validated across 1,000 building simulations with real Hungarian data
modelPerformance.dataItem3: Grid carbon intensity (MAVIR patterns, 365 daily records)
modelPerformance.optItem2: Carbon-aware scheduling based on grid intensity
modelPerformance.validationDetail: Our model was validated using 2023 Budapest weather data (8,760 hourly records), Hungarian energy patterns, and grid carbon intensity data. We simulated 1,000 building configurations with physics-based heating demand calculations, comparing our GradientBoosting model against a RandomForest baseline.

problem.title: The problem
problem.description: Building heating systems run on fixed schedules, ignoring when the grid is cleanest. This wastes energy and increases emissions unnecessarily.
problem.temporalDesc: Peak heating demand coincides with high carbon intensity. Traditional systems can't shift load to cleaner hours.
problem.forecastDesc: Grid carbon depends on renewables, weather, and demand. Requires ML models to predict 24h ahead.
problem.multiObjectiveDesc: Must optimize carbon, cost, and comfort simultaneously. No closed-form solution—requires RL.
problem.technicalChallengesDesc: Why traditional systems can't optimize for carbon intensity

howItWorks.step2Desc: Predicts optimal heating times for your building type
howItWorks.step3Desc: Works with existing systems - no installation needed
